text: Hubdb question here: I have a Zap that's using webhooks to add rows to a table that already exists in Hubdb. My Zapier sample API call is green meaning I don't get any errors however I don't see row(s) added to my Hubdb. No errors and no data
Here's more details about the question: <http://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/zapier-webhooks-hubdb-integration/14375|integrate.HubSpot.com/t/zapier-webhooks-hubdb-integration/14375>
Hey Furqan, if you go into your Zapier task history, what is the response code to the call?
Hey Mark, it's 200 Ok. I contacted Zapier and they sent me a raw response file with 200 response code

interesting -and pretty confusing if it’s not actually preventing queries from executing yet. Thank you for the info though it helps me to know the issue is more with the logic than the number of hubdb queries right now.
I plan to restructure the code so I don’t have to do the hubDB queries but have to make this thing work for the client first as is to meet a deadline.

Hey, sorry, had to jump on some meetings and projects. Check the API docs to make sure you don't need a 201 or something like that, I've had issues before where they'll accept the data, but won't actually input it unless I change my data schema
the search feature in HubDB does not search for columns with select fields that have that value
Ok thanks for the feedback. I'll check the docs
search should work now for select and multiselect columns
I think it’s worded to encourage action :slightly_smiling_face:
